meanings.sent1: It is my devoir to help my family with chores.
meanings.sent2: Completing homework is a devoir for students.
meanings.sent3: The cat felt it was his devoir to guard the house from mice.
meanings.sent4: As a parent, it is our devoir to guide our children on the right path.
meanings.sent5: The soldier saw protecting his country as his ultimate devoir.

meanings.sent1: Her devoir was to finish the project by Friday.
meanings.sent2: The devoir of cleaning the classroom was given to the students.
meanings.sent3: The devoir of finding the missing keys fell on the detective.
meanings.sent4: The devoir of baking the cake was taken on by the pastry chef.
meanings.sent5: The devoir of fixing the leaky faucet was assigned to the plumber.

meanings.definition: An act of respect or courtesy.
meanings.sent1: It is a devoir to greet your elders with a smile.
meanings.sent2: Showing gratitude is a devoir we should all practice.
meanings.sent3: The devoir of holding the door open for others is a kind gesture.
meanings.sent4: In some cultures, bowing is a devoir to show respect.
meanings.sent5: Saying 'please' and 'thank you' is a devoir of good manners.
